title: Democrats Consider an Autopsy, but Who’s the Coroner?
summary: The Democratic Party agrees it needs to figure out what went wrong. The question is how.

summary: Daniel Lurie held his first news conference since Mayor London Breed conceded the mayoral race this week.

summary: Kevin de León, a Los Angeles councilman, was the last elected official still in office among the politicians caught on an audio recording that leaked two years ago.

summary: President-elect Donald J. Trump and his allies have pledged to strike fear in the heart of what they term “the deep state.” They have already succeeded.

summary: Speaking in his home state after he and Vice President Kamala Harris lost this week, Gov. Tim Walz of Minnesota vowed to “stand ready to stand up and fight.”

summary: Ms. Wiles, a principal architect of Donald J. Trump’s 2024 presidential campaign, will become the first woman to hold the job.

summary: The loss of the White House and the Senate majority will end Democrats’ ability to fill judicial vacancies come January. They say they want to confirm as many as possible in the coming weeks.

summary: Elon Musk was with Donald Trump at Mar-a-Lago when the president-elect spoke with Ukraine’s leader. It is not clear if they discussed any change in U.S. policy toward Ukraine.

summary: “Had the president gotten out sooner, there may have been other candidates in the race,” the former House speaker said in an interview with The New York Times, suggesting she had anticipated an “open primary.”

summary: The special counsel asked for time to assess how to proceed now that Donald Trump is returning the White House, triggering a Justice Department policy against prosecuting a sitting president.

summary: Long-term economic investments in domestic manufacturing were overshadowed by real-time anxiety over rent and grocery prices.

title: Trump’s Supreme Court Agenda Is Likely to Include Legal U-Turns
summary: In recent years, new administrations have not been shy about disavowing positions taken by their predecessors.

summary: During an appearance in Wisconsin, President Biden said 10 million borrowers could see debt relief of at least $5,000. The plan could help rally support among young voters.

summary: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company plans to build an additional factory and upgrade another planned facility in Phoenix with the federal grants.
